alert.note: Alert for Kenosha; Milwaukee; Ozaukee; Racine; Sheboygan (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 11 at 9:32PM CST until January 13 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Milwaukee
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM FRIDAY TO NOON CST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 7 inches along the lakeshore to 6 to 11 inches farther inland. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph causing blowing and drifting snow. * WHERE...Sheboygan, Ozaukee, Milwaukee, Racine and Kenosha Counties. * WHEN...From 6 AM Friday to noon CST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions will impact the morning and evening commutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...There may be a lull in the heavier snow from late morning through mid-afternoon Friday. There remains some uncertainty with amounts for lakeshore areas given mild lake temps and onshore winds.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
